intro: Hemizonia congesta var. tracyi, commonly known as Tracy's hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological and horticultural studies in its native range.
